content: the friend becomes a stranger by listening to one, sings of the death, the going under, of the departed & sings of the decaying Geschlecht the stranger parted (schied)
linkedContent: the friend becomes a stranger by listening to one, sings of the death, the going under, of the departed & sings of the decaying Geschlecht the stranger parted (schied)

content: to discuss (erörten): placing/situating the site & heeding it (das Weisen in den Ort und das Beachten des Ortes) > take all our daring to take no more than these preliminary steps (vorbereitenden Schritte)
linkedContent: to discuss (erörten): placing/situating the site & heeding it (das Weisen in den Ort und das Beachten des Ortes) > take all our daring to take no more than these preliminary steps (vorbereitenden Schritte)

content: site (Ort), [originally means] die Spitze des Speers (point of the spear) [Derrida repeatedly refers to this statement], gathers into itself, to the highest and most extreme (Äusserste), a gathering that penetrates (durchdringt)/pervades (durchwest) everything > a site gathers & preserves (verwahrt) what it gathers, not like an encapsulated shell (Kapsel), but by shining through, lighting up, and thus releasing (entlässt) what it gathers to its own nature

motif.title: DERRIDA CONFESSES, SUMMARIZES in "Punctuations: the Time of a Thesis"

motif.title: PREORGINARY SYNTHESIS [Derrida bringing together instead of dividing?]

content: [though poetic dialogue only true dialogue] sometimes necessary for there to be a dialogue btwn thinking/poetry: aims to call forth (hervorzurufen) Wesen of Sprache, so mortals can learn to live again w/in language

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

motif.name: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE
motif.title: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE

linkedContent: [though poetic dialogue only true dialogue] sometimes necessary for there to be a dialogue btwn thinking/poetry: aims to call forth (hervorzurufen) Wesen of Sprache, so mortals can learn to live again w/in language

content: [Heidegger discusses the relation btwn clarification (Erläuterung) of poem and discussion (Erörterung)] to discuss must pass through clarification, any right clarification [another version of authenticity] presupposes discussion: thinking dialogue (denkende Zwiesprache) w/ Gedicht remains (verharrt) w/in reciprocity (Wechselbezug) btwn clarification/discussion > only poetic dialogue w/ Gedicht is true dialogue: poetic conversation (Gespräch) btwn poets
linkedContent: [Heidegger discusses the relation btwn clarification (Erläuterung) of poem and discussion (Erörterung)] to discuss must pass through clarification, any right clarification [another version of authenticity] presupposes discussion: thinking dialogue (denkende Zwiesprache) w/ Gedicht remains (verharrt) w/in reciprocity (Wechselbezug) btwn clarification/discussion > only poetic dialogue w/ Gedicht is true dialogue: poetic conversation (Gespräch) btwn poets

content: poet’s statement remains unspoken, from its site rise waves, moving the Saying, each wave causes movement of Saying to flow back into ever more hidden source (verhüllteren Ursprung) > from metaphysical-aesthetic point of view: the site/source of wave holds (birgt) w/in hidden nature of what first appears as rhythm
linkedContent: poet’s statement remains unspoken, from its site rise waves, moving the Saying, each wave causes movement of Saying to flow back into ever more hidden source (verhüllteren Ursprung) > from metaphysical-aesthetic point of view: the site/source of wave holds (birgt) w/in hidden nature of what first appears as rhythm

content: every great poet creates poetry from one single poetic statement (Gedicht), only > his greatness measured by the way he commits (anvertraut) to this singleness (Einzigen) so to keep (halten) his Sage wholly w/in it

motif.name: UNSCATHED / SAFE / SACRED / GUARD / SECURITY / KEEP
motif.title: UNSCATHED / SAFE / SACRED / GUARD / SECURITY / KEEP

linkedContent: every great poet creates poetry from one single poetic statement (Gedicht), only > his greatness measured by the way he commits (anvertraut) to this singleness (Einzigen) so to keep (halten) his Sage wholly w/in it

content: thinking dialogue w/ poetry always risks interfering w/ Sage of Gedicht, rather than letting it sing from its proper peace (eigenen Ruhe) > Erörterung of Gedicht can never substitute (ersetzen) or guide (leiten) our listening (Hören) to the poem, can make our Hören more thought-provoking/reflective (besinnlicher) [prosthesis, substitute]
linkedContent: thinking dialogue w/ poetry always risks interfering w/ Sage of Gedicht, rather than letting it sing from its proper peace (eigenen Ruhe) > Erörterung of Gedicht can never substitute (ersetzen) or guide (leiten) our listening (Hören) to the poem, can make our Hören more thought-provoking/reflective (besinnlicher) [prosthesis, substitute]

content: [how can Heidegger be sure that a Gedicht has one site?]
linkedContent: [how can Heidegger be sure that a Gedicht has one site?]

content: since Plato, soul suprasensuous (Übersinnlichen), if it appears in sensible world, does so as a castaway (verschlagen) > on Earth, soul doesn’t have the right cast (rechten Schlag), doesn’t belong, is something strange (ein Fremdes) [body is soul’s prison]
linkedContent: since Plato, soul suprasensuous (Übersinnlichen), if it appears in sensible world, does so as a castaway (verschlagen) > on Earth, soul doesn’t have the right cast (rechten Schlag), doesn’t belong, is something strange (ein Fremdes) [body is soul’s prison]

content: strange “fremd”: Old High German fram, “forward to somewhere else (anderswohin vorwärts), underway toward (unterwegs nach),” dem Voraufbehaltenen entgegen > strange searches for site where can remain in its wandering: barely exposed to itself, still follows the call of the way to its own

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

linkedContent: strange “fremd”: Old High German fram, “forward to somewhere else (anderswohin vorwärts), underway toward (unterwegs nach),” dem Voraufbehaltenen entgegen > strange searches for site where can remain in its wandering: barely exposed to itself, still follows the call of the way to its own

content: soul is strange on earth (Wesen of soul), always underway, follows the draw (Zug) of its nature > earth where the soul’s wandering can’t reach, soul seeks (sucht) the earth [Schelling], such poetic wandering builds/dwells on earth, can save (retten) the earth as earth
linkedContent: soul is strange on earth (Wesen of soul), always underway, follows the draw (Zug) of its nature > earth where the soul’s wandering can’t reach, soul seeks (sucht) the earth [Schelling], such poetic wandering builds/dwells on earth, can save (retten) the earth as earth

content: [finitude] soul called to die, to go under, Untergang, to leave the earth behind: not a catastrophe, not a mere withering decay (Verfall) > Der Schritt des Fremden goes away in the dusk/twilight (Dämmerung), not Untergang (destruction, twilight of end), Auch der Morgen dämmert, twilight also a rising (Aufgehen), night’s blue rises > Ghostly (Geistliche) twilights the blue, ghostly marks (kennzeichnet) the twilight

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

linkedContent: [finitude] soul called to die, to go under, Untergang, to leave the earth behind: not a catastrophe, not a mere withering decay (Verfall) > Der Schritt des Fremden goes away in the dusk/twilight (Dämmerung), not Untergang (destruction, twilight of end), Auch der Morgen dämmert, twilight also a rising (Aufgehen), night’s blue rises > Ghostly (Geistliche) twilights the blue, ghostly marks (kennzeichnet) the twilight

content: “so quiet” appears again and again in Trakl, quiet (leise) means slow (langam) > night, blue game, shy, gentle sheaf: “the sheaf of blueness gathers the depth (Tiefe) of the holy in the depths (Grund) of its bond” > holy withholds in withdrawing > Es [the holy] verschenkt seine Ankunft [bestows its arrival], indem es sich in den verhaltenden Entzug verwahrt [while/by guarding itself in its withholding withdrawal]

motif.name: UNSCATHED / SAFE / SACRED / GUARD / SECURITY / KEEP
motif.title: UNSCATHED / SAFE / SACRED / GUARD / SECURITY / KEEP

linkedContent: “so quiet” appears again and again in Trakl, quiet (leise) means slow (langam) > night, blue game, shy, gentle sheaf: “the sheaf of blueness gathers the depth (Tiefe) of the holy in the depths (Grund) of its bond” > holy withholds in withdrawing > Es [the holy] verschenkt seine Ankunft [bestows its arrival], indem es sich in den verhaltenden Entzug verwahrt [while/by guarding itself in its withholding withdrawal]

content: indeterminacy of animal face in Trakl, not yet gathered into its essential being, the thinking animal, animal rationale, man
linkedContent: indeterminacy of animal face in Trakl, not yet gathered into its essential being, the thinking animal, animal rationale, man

content: stones gather soothing power (Besänftigende), pain stills toward Wesenshafte > gentleness (Sanfte), of blue, transmutes (verwandelt) discord (Zwietracht) by absorbing (verwindet) [?] into appeased pain (beruhigten Schmerz)
linkedContent: stones gather soothing power (Besänftigende), pain stills toward Wesenshafte > gentleness (Sanfte), of blue, transmutes (verwandelt) discord (Zwietracht) by absorbing (verwindet) [?] into appeased pain (beruhigten Schmerz)

content: in Trakl, blue not an image to mark holy [symbol?], blue is the depth of the holy—because of its gathering > frozen rigor (Starre) of animal face not that of dead [rigor mortis], gathers into silent gaze (Aussehen) toward holy
linkedContent: in Trakl, blue not an image to mark holy [symbol?], blue is the depth of the holy—because of its gathering > frozen rigor (Starre) of animal face not that of dead [rigor mortis], gathers into silent gaze (Aussehen) toward holy

content: Trakl’s “blue wild game”: countering glance (Gegenblick) of human nature, thought of stranger’s steps, illumined by holy; “blue wild game”: names mortals who think of stranger, wander w/ him to home (Einheimische) of human being > they are few/unknown who begin such journey: what is of the essence occurs (ereignet) rarely, suddenly, in quiet [instant, event]
linkedContent: Trakl’s “blue wild game”: countering glance (Gegenblick) of human nature, thought of stranger’s steps, illumined by holy; “blue wild game”: names mortals who think of stranger, wander w/ him to home (Einheimische) of human being > they are few/unknown who begin such journey: what is of the essence occurs (ereignet) rarely, suddenly, in quiet [instant, event]

content: in Trakl’s “Seven-Song of Death,” death: the Untergang to which ein Fremdes is called [the going down of a stranger]

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

linkedContent: in Trakl’s “Seven-Song of Death,” death: the Untergang to which ein Fremdes is called [the going down of a stranger]

content: the indeterminacy of man [via Trakl] means man is all too firmly confirmed as factum (Tatsache) [factical life], not yet been gathered/brought (gebracht) to firm ground (Feste), “home,” in das Einheimische ihres verhüllten Wesens > Western-European metaphysics may be struggling in vain, its way to the Unterwegs may be blocked: modern man is the animal not yet determined (fest-gestellte Tier) in its nature
linkedContent: the indeterminacy of man [via Trakl] means man is all too firmly confirmed as factum (Tatsache) [factical life], not yet been gathered/brought (gebracht) to firm ground (Feste), “home,” in das Einheimische ihres verhüllten Wesens > Western-European metaphysics may be struggling in vain, its way to the Unterwegs may be blocked: modern man is the animal not yet determined (fest-gestellte Tier) in its nature

content: night: sheltering veiling of sun’s course > [paths] walk, ienai, ier, the year [Derrida’s anniversary ring] > Das Geistliche der Jahre: der geistlich dämmernden Bläue der Nacht
linkedContent: night: sheltering veiling of sun’s course > [paths] walk, ienai, ier, the year [Derrida’s anniversary ring] > Das Geistliche der Jahre: der geistlich dämmernden Bläue der Nacht

content: when mortals follow something strange down, when called, they themselves enter (gelangen) strangeness, become strangers & solitary (Einsame)

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

linkedContent: when mortals follow something strange down, when called, they themselves enter (gelangen) strangeness, become strangers & solitary (Einsame)

content: in Trakl’s “Geistliche Dämmerung,” the waters (sometimes black, sometimes blue): show man his countenance (Antlitz), his countering glance (Gegenblick)
linkedContent: in Trakl’s “Geistliche Dämmerung,” the waters (sometimes black, sometimes blue): show man his countenance (Antlitz), his countering glance (Gegenblick)

content: Geschlecht (kin, kind, generation): a human cast away (verschlagene) from Menschenwesen, stamped (geprägte) in one cast (einem Schlag) > Geschlecht: both mankind as a whole and kinship of race, tribe, family, all of these stamped in the duality of the sexes (Zwiefache der Geschlechter), decomposed form of man, man unsettled (entsetzte) > a curse (Fluch) has struck man [cf. Derrida on Geschlecht, 2nd blow of sexes] > not duality (Zwiefache) but discord (Zwietracht) is the curse

motif.name: DERRIDA CONFESSES, SUMMARIZES in "Punctuations: the Time of a Thesis"
motif.title: DERRIDA CONFESSES, SUMMARIZES in "Punctuations: the Time of a Thesis"

motif.name: PREORGINARY SYNTHESIS [Derrida bringing together instead of dividing?]
motif.title: PREORGINARY SYNTHESIS [Derrida bringing together instead of dividing?]

linkedContent: Geschlecht (kin, kind, generation): a human cast away (verschlagene) from Menschenwesen, stamped (geprägte) in one cast (einem Schlag) > Geschlecht: both mankind as a whole and kinship of race, tribe, family, all of these stamped in the duality of the sexes (Zwiefache der Geschlechter), decomposed form of man, man unsettled (entsetzte) > a curse (Fluch) has struck man [cf. Derrida on Geschlecht, 2nd blow of sexes] > not duality (Zwiefache) but discord (Zwietracht) is the curse

content: the wanderers who follow strangers [now strangers themselves], now split (geschieden) from “loved ones,” to the strangers they are “others”: “the cast of the decomposed form of man (der Schlag der verwesten Gestalt des Menschen)”
linkedContent: the wanderers who follow strangers [now strangers themselves], now split (geschieden) from “loved ones,” to the strangers they are “others”: “the cast of the decomposed form of man (der Schlag der verwesten Gestalt des Menschen)”

content: turmoil, curse, [2nd blow], carries each kind (Geschlechter) into irreconcilable split, fragmented stamp, so cleft in 2, can’t find its proper cast (rechter Schlag) [differance not primary for Heidegger here] > the duality of proper cast leaves discord behind, leading into gentleness of simple twofoldness (einfältigen Zwiefalt) [Schelling’s indifference point? sexual difference that isn’t the discord of sexual duality], follows the stranger
linkedContent: turmoil, curse, [2nd blow], carries each kind (Geschlechter) into irreconcilable split, fragmented stamp, so cleft in 2, can’t find its proper cast (rechter Schlag) [differance not primary for Heidegger here] > the duality of proper cast leaves discord behind, leading into gentleness of simple twofoldness (einfältigen Zwiefalt) [Schelling’s indifference point? sexual difference that isn’t the discord of sexual duality], follows the stranger

content: re: stranger, all who come from the decomposed kind (verwesende Geschlechtes) are others > stranger (Fremdling): “He yonder,” the one who is apart (Ab-geschiedene) > strange thing (Fremdes) called to lose itself, to go under, but that does not mean it’s annihilated (Vernichtung) [or crumbles into shambles]

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

linkedContent: re: stranger, all who come from the decomposed kind (verwesende Geschlechtes) are others > stranger (Fremdling): “He yonder,” the one who is apart (Ab-geschiedene) > strange thing (Fremdes) called to lose itself, to go under, but that does not mean it’s annihilated (Vernichtung) [or crumbles into shambles]

content: night makes the thinker speak other words, can transmute because it too changes > Day’s decline not an end, but makes ready the beginning of Stranger’s wandering > the site of Trakl’s poems: die Abgeschiedenheit (apartness)

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

linkedContent: night makes the thinker speak other words, can transmute because it too changes > Day’s decline not an end, but makes ready the beginning of Stranger’s wandering > the site of Trakl’s poems: die Abgeschiedenheit (apartness)

content: [p.172 who is the Abgeschiedene (the departed one)?] the dead one (Gestorbene) lives in his grave, the dead one is the madman (Wahnsinnige) > madness not as mental illness, he is of another mind, taken his way in another direction, his madness “gentle,” his mind pursues a greater stillness
linkedContent: [p.172 who is the Abgeschiedene (the departed one)?] the dead one (Gestorbene) lives in his grave, the dead one is the madman (Wahnsinnige) > madness not as mental illness, he is of another mind, taken his way in another direction, his madness “gentle,” his mind pursues a greater stillness

content: in Trakl, “the boy’s blue voice retrieves (zurückholt) something forgotten and fore-tells (vorsagt) it” [cf. youth in Evening Conversations] [p. 178 earliness of long since dead promises “springtime of the soul”]> the boy? Elis, the stranger called to go under (Elis different from Trakl, like Zarathustra different from Nietzsche) > Elis goes down into uralte Frühe, older than decomposing Geschlecht, older because more mindful (sinnender), more mindful because more still, more still because self-stilling > boy Elis shelters/stores gentle two-fold of sex [sexual difference not in discord of duality]

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

linkedContent: in Trakl, “the boy’s blue voice retrieves (zurückholt) something forgotten and fore-tells (vorsagt) it” [cf. youth in Evening Conversations] [p. 178 earliness of long since dead promises “springtime of the soul”]> the boy? Elis, the stranger called to go under (Elis different from Trakl, like Zarathustra different from Nietzsche) > Elis goes down into uralte Frühe, older than decomposing Geschlecht, older because more mindful (sinnender), more mindful because more still, more still because self-stilling > boy Elis shelters/stores gentle two-fold of sex [sexual difference not in discord of duality]

content: [2 kinds of “a dead”] Elis doesn’t decay/cease to be, he moves away into earliness > “stranger unfolds human nature forward into the beginning” of what has not yet come to be carried (Tragen, giberan) > Trakl calls this quieter/stilling element: the unborn (Ungeborene) > “something strange” = “something unborn”

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

linkedContent: [2 kinds of “a dead”] Elis doesn’t decay/cease to be, he moves away into earliness > “stranger unfolds human nature forward into the beginning” of what has not yet come to be carried (Tragen, giberan) > Trakl calls this quieter/stilling element: the unborn (Ungeborene) > “something strange” = “something unborn”

content: Trakl: “And the unborn tends to its own peace” [cf. the dead bury their dead] > unborn guards (hütet)/watches over (wahrt) the stiller childhood, “for the coming awakening of mankind” > at rest, the early dead (Frühvestorbene) lives [the 2nd kind of “a dead”: the stranger, the departed, the unborn], promises the gentler two-fold of mankind [sexual difference no in discord of duality]

motif.name: UNSCATHED / SAFE / SACRED / GUARD / SECURITY / KEEP
motif.title: UNSCATHED / SAFE / SACRED / GUARD / SECURITY / KEEP

linkedContent: Trakl: “And the unborn tends to its own peace” [cf. the dead bury their dead] > unborn guards (hütet)/watches over (wahrt) the stiller childhood, “for the coming awakening of mankind” > at rest, the early dead (Frühvestorbene) lives [the 2nd kind of “a dead”: the stranger, the departed, the unborn], promises the gentler two-fold of mankind [sexual difference no in discord of duality]

content: true time (wahre Zeit), the arrival (Ankunft) of what has been (Gewesenen) > not the past, but gathering of Wesenden, which precedes all arrival: gathers itself into shelter of the earlier [before the given moment?] [no presence/arrival in true time?]

motif.name: DERRIDA CONFESSES, SUMMARIZES in "Punctuations: the Time of a Thesis"
motif.title: DERRIDA CONFESSES, SUMMARIZES in "Punctuations: the Time of a Thesis"

linkedContent: true time (wahre Zeit), the arrival (Ankunft) of what has been (Gewesenen) > not the past, but gathering of Wesenden, which precedes all arrival: gathers itself into shelter of the earlier [before the given moment?] [no presence/arrival in true time?]

content: gold, truth, rightness > [death] earliness in which stranger has expired (verstorben), shelters the Wesensgerechte of the unborn > the end (Ende) not sequel (Folge) of beginning, its the end of decaying Geschlechtes, thus precedes (vorauf) beginning of unborn Geschlechtes: as earlier earliness, has already overtaken the end
linkedContent: gold, truth, rightness > [death] earliness in which stranger has expired (verstorben), shelters the Wesensgerechte of the unborn > the end (Ende) not sequel (Folge) of beginning, its the end of decaying Geschlechtes, thus precedes (vorauf) beginning of unborn Geschlechtes: as earlier earliness, has already overtaken the end

content: nocturnal silence (Schweigen der Nacht), silence itself w/ its night, belongs (gehört) to apartness (Abgeschiedenheit), die Dämmerung als das Tor zum Untergang [passage], the soul’s nocturnal wing-beat (der nächtliche Flügelschlag der Seele) > [the reign of this gathering in apartness unfolds w/out delay, nicht nachträglich] > the apartness is ghostly (geistlich) > [sister of stormy sadness]
linkedContent: nocturnal silence (Schweigen der Nacht), silence itself w/ its night, belongs (gehört) to apartness (Abgeschiedenheit), die Dämmerung als das Tor zum Untergang [passage], the soul’s nocturnal wing-beat (der nächtliche Flügelschlag der Seele) > [the reign of this gathering in apartness unfolds w/out delay, nicht nachträglich] > the apartness is ghostly (geistlich) > [sister of stormy sadness]

content: ghostly (Geistliche) means spiritual, but not that of the church or priest, no ecclesiastical overtones for Trakl > he doesn’t use “of the spirit (Geistige),” since this would directly oppose material
linkedContent: ghostly (Geistliche) means spiritual, but not that of the church or priest, no ecclesiastical overtones for Trakl > he doesn’t use “of the spirit (Geistige),” since this would directly oppose material

content: Geist (ghost or spirit), via Trakl, possibility of both gentleness and destructiveness (Zerstörerischen) > Das Sanfte [gentleness] schlägt jenes Außer-sich des Entflammenden keineswegs nieder, sondern hält es in der Ruhe des Freundlichen versammelt [holds ek-stasis in peace of friendship] > Das Zerstörerische [destructiveness] kommt aus dem Zügellosen, das sich im eigenen Aufruhr verzehrt und so das Bösartige betreibt [consumes itself, unbridled evil] > evil is ghostly, the revolt (Aufruhr) of a terror blazing away in blindness, the ungathered, fragmented, unholy—threatens to turn gentleness to ash (des Sanften zu versengen droht) [cf. Derrida on absolute ash]

motif.name: DERRIDA CONFESSES, SUMMARIZES in "Punctuations: the Time of a Thesis"
motif.title: DERRIDA CONFESSES, SUMMARIZES in "Punctuations: the Time of a Thesis"

motif.name: PREORGINARY SYNTHESIS [Derrida bringing together instead of dividing?]
motif.title: PREORGINARY SYNTHESIS [Derrida bringing together instead of dividing?]

linkedContent: Geist (ghost or spirit), via Trakl, possibility of both gentleness and destructiveness (Zerstörerischen) > Das Sanfte [gentleness] schlägt jenes Außer-sich des Entflammenden keineswegs nieder, sondern hält es in der Ruhe des Freundlichen versammelt [holds ek-stasis in peace of friendship] > Das Zerstörerische [destructiveness] kommt aus dem Zügellosen, das sich im eigenen Aufruhr verzehrt und so das Bösartige betreibt [consumes itself, unbridled evil] > evil is ghostly, the revolt (Aufruhr) of a terror blazing away in blindness, the ungathered, fragmented, unholy—threatens to turn gentleness to ash (des Sanften zu versengen droht) [cf. Derrida on absolute ash]

content: via Trakl, apartness is spiritual/ghostly (geistlich), vom Geist bestimmt, but not “of the spirit (geistig)” (in metaphysical sense) > for Trakl, in “Grodek,” spirit is flaming, not pneuma (ethereal), but a flame that inflames, startles (aufjagt), horrifies (entsetzt), shatters us, the glowing lumination > flame is the ek-stasis (Ausser-sich), which lightens and calls forth radiance, but may go on consuming (weiterfressen) and reduce (verzehren) all to white ashes [cf. Derrida on absolute ash] > “Flame is the palest pallor’s brother” > Geist, for Trakl, as gheis (ghost), a being terrified (aufgebracht), beside himself (entsetzt), ek-static

linkedContent: via Trakl, apartness is spiritual/ghostly (geistlich), vom Geist bestimmt, but not “of the spirit (geistig)” (in metaphysical sense) > for Trakl, in “Grodek,” spirit is flaming, not pneuma (ethereal), but a flame that inflames, startles (aufjagt), horrifies (entsetzt), shatters us, the glowing lumination > flame is the ek-stasis (Ausser-sich), which lightens and calls forth radiance, but may go on consuming (weiterfressen) and reduce (verzehren) all to white ashes [cf. Derrida on absolute ash] > “Flame is the palest pallor’s brother” > Geist, for Trakl, as gheis (ghost), a being terrified (aufgebracht), beside himself (entsetzt), ek-static

content: solitude (Einsame) carries soul toward the One (Einzigen), the burden (Schwere) of fate: carry the soul toward the spirit > soul’s melancholy glows when Soul in journey enters the widest width of its properness (ihres eigenen), which is wandering > soul’s greatness, achieve flaming vision (Anschauen), becomes at home (proper) in pain [pain as MOP?]: pain’s nature is in itself converse (gegenwendiges)
linkedContent: solitude (Einsame) carries soul toward the One (Einzigen), the burden (Schwere) of fate: carry the soul toward the spirit > soul’s melancholy glows when Soul in journey enters the widest width of its properness (ihres eigenen), which is wandering > soul’s greatness, achieve flaming vision (Anschauen), becomes at home (proper) in pain [pain as MOP?]: pain’s nature is in itself converse (gegenwendiges)

content: flaming pain tears away, its rending (Fortriss) consigns [marks?] (einzeichnet) wandering soul to conjunction (Fuge) of storm [heaven]/hunt [God] > would seem pain’s rending would overwhelm (überwältigen), rather than letting soul prevail (walten) in veiling radiance > but! [here is Heidegger’s refusal of differance], the beholding vision (Anschauen) can rejoin (fügt zurück) the flaming sweep (flammenden Fortriss) to the fitting submission (Fügsame) of seeing acceptance (schaunden Hinnehmens) [moral image of thought], der Rückriss im Schmerz, pain achieves its mildness, its power (Walten) to convey/disclose
linkedContent: flaming pain tears away, its rending (Fortriss) consigns [marks?] (einzeichnet) wandering soul to conjunction (Fuge) of storm [heaven]/hunt [God] > would seem pain’s rending would overwhelm (überwältigen), rather than letting soul prevail (walten) in veiling radiance > but! [here is Heidegger’s refusal of differance], the beholding vision (Anschauen) can rejoin (fügt zurück) the flaming sweep (flammenden Fortriss) to the fitting submission (Fügsame) of seeing acceptance (schaunden Hinnehmens) [moral image of thought], der Rückriss im Schmerz, pain achieves its mildness, its power (Walten) to convey/disclose

content: [spirit & soul] spirit drives soul in das Unterwegs, carries soul over to strangeness > soul is gifted (beschenkt) w/ the soul > spirit is the animator (Beseeler) [cf. p. 181 pain animates] > but soul guards the spirit, “feeds” it, no spirit w/out soul: soul invests spirit w/ flame (its very nature), the glow of melancholy (Schwermut), “the patience (Sanftmut) of the lonely (einsamen) soul”

motif.name: UNSCATHED / SAFE / SACRED / GUARD / SECURITY / KEEP
motif.title: UNSCATHED / SAFE / SACRED / GUARD / SECURITY / KEEP

linkedContent: [spirit & soul] spirit drives soul in das Unterwegs, carries soul over to strangeness > soul is gifted (beschenkt) w/ the soul > spirit is the animator (Beseeler) [cf. p. 181 pain animates] > but soul guards the spirit, “feeds” it, no spirit w/out soul: soul invests spirit w/ flame (its very nature), the glow of melancholy (Schwermut), “the patience (Sanftmut) of the lonely (einsamen) soul”

content: spirit is flame, its shining occurs (geschieht) im Blick des Anschauens > Solchem Anschauen ereignet sich die Ankunft des Scheinenden, worin alles Wesende anwest [the accepting vision that tames pain enowns the arrival of all that shines, where all that is, is present] > nature of vision impenetrable to those who understand pain as sensitivity
linkedContent: spirit is flame, its shining occurs (geschieht) im Blick des Anschauens > Solchem Anschauen ereignet sich die Ankunft des Scheinenden, worin alles Wesende anwest [the accepting vision that tames pain enowns the arrival of all that shines, where all that is, is present] > nature of vision impenetrable to those who understand pain as sensitivity

content: soul: great giver of life > everything that is alive is painful > pain is the animator (Beseelende) [cf. 180 the soul is the animator] > only the soulful fulfills destiny, capable, gifted as such, of joining in harmony the mutual bearing (wechselweisen Sichtragens) by which all living things belong > relation of fitness (Bezug des Taugens), all that lives is fit, i.e. good: good is good painfully > only true in pain > because pain is converse, kann das Lebende sein Mitanwesendes in seiner jeweiligen Art verbergend entbergen [sheltering concealment], wahr-haft [preservation/truth] sein lassen [truth as letting beings truly be what they are]

motif.name: SACRIFICE [to define, philosophy of life required]
motif.title: SACRIFICE [to define, philosophy of life required]

content: “softly (leise)” always leads us softly to essential relations (wesenhaften Bezüge) > pain conceals itself in stone (petrifying pain) > silent glow of 1st dawn (earliest, ancient origin [uralte Herkunft]), the prior beginning coming toward everything that is becoming (Werdende), brings it to the never-to-be-obtained arrival [the never-arriving arrival] (nie einholbare Ankunft) of its essential being
linkedContent: “softly (leise)” always leads us softly to essential relations (wesenhaften Bezüge) > pain conceals itself in stone (petrifying pain) > silent glow of 1st dawn (earliest, ancient origin [uralte Herkunft]), the prior beginning coming toward everything that is becoming (Werdende), brings it to the never-to-be-obtained arrival [the never-arriving arrival] (nie einholbare Ankunft) of its essential being

content: sickness, disease: single semblance (einzige Anschein) in which truth truly conceals itself [why would there be but one semblance?]
linkedContent: sickness, disease: single semblance (einzige Anschein) in which truth truly conceals itself [why would there be but one semblance?]

content: pain is the favor/benignity (Gunst) in nature of all essential being > the onefold simplicity (Einfalt) of its converse (gegenwendigen) nature “determines (bestimmt) all becoming out of concealed primal earliness, and attunes (stimmt) it to the bright serenity of the great soul”
linkedContent: pain is the favor/benignity (Gunst) in nature of all essential being > the onefold simplicity (Einfalt) of its converse (gegenwendigen) nature “determines (bestimmt) all becoming out of concealed primal earliness, and attunes (stimmt) it to the bright serenity of the great soul”

content: beneath the one semblance is concealed the Einfalt of pain, flaming the furthest when holds to itself most intimately [beholding vision] > pain as Grundzug of great soul, in pure harmony w/ holiness of blue: “blue shines upon the soul’s face by withdrawing into its own depth” > holy is present (west)/endures (währt) only by keeping w/in this withdrawal (in diesem Entzug verhält), turning vision toward fitting (Fügsame) [via flame of pain]

content: Trakl’s poems: lyric, tragedy, epic all in one
linkedContent: Trakl’s poems: lyric, tragedy, epic all in one

content: Trakl calls unborn “grandsons” because they do not continue decaying generation [Geschlecht], they are another Generation (andere Generation) [sweeping summary in one sentence: pain, vision, flame, look ahead into withdrawing earliness, ghosts]

content: pain only truly pain when serves (dient) flame of spirit
linkedContent: pain only truly pain when serves (dient) flame of spirit

content: apartness is active (west) as pure spirit, radiance of blue, kindles (entflammt) a stiller childhood into the gold of 1st beginning > Elis turns his golden countenance toward this earliness, his Gegenblick keeps/guards (wahrt) nocturnal flame of spirit of apartness [what hermeneutic circle names superficially, attention]

content: the way apartness flames, it is spirit & thus gathering power, Das Versammelnde der Abgeschiedenheit, saves the unborn beyond the used-up for a coming rebirth of mankind, gathering power, spirit of gentleness, stills spirit of evil

content: in Einfalt of childhood is hidden (verbirgt) the geschwisterliche Zwiefalt des Menschengeschlechtes [the brotherly/sisterly twofoldness of mankind] > in apartness, evil neither destroyed/denied nor set free/affirmed: evil is transformed (to endure this transformation, soul must be great)

content: as gathering, apartness has the nature of a site
linkedContent: as gathering, apartness has the nature of a site

content: apartness not the desolation (Ödnis) of departed dead > stranger measures off (durchmisst) the parting (Abschied) from previous Geschlecht [mankind hitherto], he is underway on a path (Pfad) > departed, the stranger is set apart, one of the select (Erlesenen)

linkedContent: to sing: to praise/guard the object of praise in song

content: in singing his song, friend becomes the stranger’s brother & also brother of stranger’s sister
linkedContent: in singing his song, friend becomes the stranger’s brother & also brother of stranger’s sister

content: friend’s invitation (Einladung) to conversation (Gespräch) reflects (entspricht) haunting music of stranger’s steps > the Sage of the friend: singing journey by stream [path]
linkedContent: friend’s invitation (Einladung) to conversation (Gespräch) reflects (entspricht) haunting music of stranger’s steps > the Sage of the friend: singing journey by stream [path]

content: Das Wesen der singenden Seele ist dann nur noch ein einziges Vorausschauen in die Bläue der Nacht, die jene stillere Frühe birgt [moral image of thought] [Gegenblick?] > nature of apartness is perfected (vollendet) [MOP? pure bastard?] > perfect site of poetic work: gathers those who died early, followed the stranger (gathers both stiller childhood & stranger’s grave)
linkedContent: Das Wesen der singenden Seele ist dann nur noch ein einziges Vorausschauen in die Bläue der Nacht, die jene stillere Frühe birgt [moral image of thought] [Gegenblick?] > nature of apartness is perfected (vollendet) [MOP? pure bastard?] > perfect site of poetic work: gathers those who died early, followed the stranger (gathers both stiller childhood & stranger’s grave)

content: poet’s work is only a listening, it’s language becomes a saying after (nachsagenden) > poetry’s spoken word guards Gedicht, as that which remains, essential in it, unspoken > when the saying-after must listen, becomes more pious, i.e. fügsamer gegenüber dem Zuspruch des Pfades [more fittingly submissive re: the promptings of the path] [traces?]

linkedContent: friend gazing at stranger, parts from cast (Schlag) of man that has forgotten [Being] stiller childhood & never carried unborn to full term [?]

content: Dieses Scheiden [from the old Geschlecht] ist verborgen geschicklich ent-schieden zum Abschied, der aus der Abgeschiedenheit zugerufen wird [the call of apartness] > the wandering of apartness [in night]: “unendliche Qual (infinite torment),” i.e. perfect pain, pain come to its fullness > the Einfalt of the converseness that prevails in pain comes to pure play (reine Spiel) only by wandering through ghostly night & parting from the unghostly night [ontic/ontological]

content: Trakl’s path leads away from old degenerate generation (alten entarteten Geschlecht) to the unborn Geschlecht (in the earliness) > language of this poetry answers to the home-coming (Heimkehr) of the unborn Menschengeschlechtes > the poetic language stems (spricht) from this transition (Übergang) [differance?]: btwn decay & twilit blue of holy

content: speaking from wandering of apartness, this language of poetry always speaks of what it leaves behind, what it parts from, and of that to which the departure submits (der Abschied sich bescheidet)

content: grisly laughter of gold, poetry’s innermost site [?], a gathering, a unison (Einklang), meant for itself alone > Trakl’s ambiguity not imprecision but peerless rigor (Strenge) of him who entered “gerechten Anschauens (righteous vision)” and fittingly submits (fügt) to it: infinitely superior to all technical precision merely scientifically univocal [a higher univocality]

content: on the Christianity of Trakl: why doesn’t he call out to God/Christ? why does he call instead to “sister’s swaying shadow,” calling her “the greeting one”? > a Lament not about redemption, a lament that urges Sister to look

content: wing-beat (Flügelschlag) of the soul
linkedContent: wing-beat (Flügelschlag) of the soul

content: Trakl silently sounds the mystery (Geheimnis) > the unity (Einheit) of “One Generation (Ein Geschlecht),” arises (entquillt) from the race (Schlag) that gathers along path of stranger, enfolds discord of generations into gentler two-fold > One of One Generation, not opposed to two but hidden unifying force [indifference point?] > Geschlecht names historical generation of man, mankind as distinct (Unterschied) from all other living creatures, names race, tribes, clans, families, & always refers to twofoldness of sexes

content: Trakl’s poetry doesn’t need historical objects because historical in highest sense: sings of the destiny of casts/blows (Geschick des Schlages), that which casts Menschengeschlecht away (verschlägt) in its still withheld nature [?]—i.e. saves mankind
